name: No-Mayo Tuna Salad
author: CCOVEY
summary: This is my Mom's recipe for tuna salad which happens to contain no mayonnaise. Being Catholic, we had it every Friday night for dinner. Serve on bread or lettuce.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups bread and butter pickles
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water
Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat
Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water and cool under cold running water
Place the eggs and pickles into a food processor; pulse until roughly chopped
Transfer to a medium bowl and stir in tuna and celery
Season with salt and pepper, and stir in the pickle juice until thoroughly blended
